result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark E Michalski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur.  Transfer of probation authorized to Arizona.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply. To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$343  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward SB.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample-on file.
Crt orders all remaining costs be converted to civil judgment.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge + court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.
Court costs remitted. $67 VW Surcharge  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 1.

ADDRESS INFO for Mark E Michalski
Current: Homeless,   (Effective: 02-18-2014)
Prior: Dane County Jail,

Defn Mark Michalski by telephone; ADA Corey Stephan in person
Court contacted Defn by telephone.  Defn in VA Hospital.   Defn has been in court several times without counsel.   Defn believes he will be discharged within next couple of days.  ADA wants court to discuss with defn that if he fails to get an attorney or file the documents to get an attorney that the court can find that defn waives counsel.  ADA states defn's address is at victim's apartment so court needs to get new address.    Defn also needs to sign bail bond form from last hearing.   Defn was not arrested after last hearing.   Court previously spoke with defn about counsel as well as court commissioner did too.  Court stated to defn's address is the victim's place and he can't be there.  Defn states he is homeless and will have to get a PO Box.  He isn't presently receiving notice.  ADA states for purposes of notice for next hearing, he believes the court can make a record that defn rec'd notice over the phone.  ADA also wants court to go over bail/bond conditions with defn over the phone.   Court will set case over to Tuesday, 3/25/14 @ 3:30 p.m.   Defn needs to appear in person for the hearing.   Court states this is an order for his appearance.  Court orders defn to sign his new bail form.  Court read conditions of bond to defn.  Court wants update on what efforts defn made to get county paid attorney.  Defn states he has bank statements of direct deposits, bank statement on motorcycle, loans.  Ct states defn also needs to bring paperwork from SPD that denied him counsel.  Defn will need to fillout FDS and go to COC to see if he qualifies.  He also needs to bring check stub and documents on any assistance or benefits he is receiving.   Court states this is the 4th conversation the court or commissioner has had with defn about getting counsel.   If the court has another conversation about not getting an attorney or filing the appropriate documents, the court may deem defn waives counsel.  Court again told defn of 3/25/14 hearing @ 3:30 pm.

Defn bailed himself out of jail.  Defn appears today without counsel.   Court thought defn was going to retain Atty Spears, but he wants $5,000 retainer.  SPD denied defn counsel.  Court will set case for prel hearing.  Court won't make him go forward today without counsel, but directs defn to retain counsel, appeal SPD determination or try and get county appointed attorney.  Court went through financial info with defn.   Court now states the she will set case for STC.  Defn to fill out financial statement completely and  have it filed out and filed with the court at next hearing.   FDS needs to be notarized.  He needs to bring supporting documents Court states if defn fails to retain counsel or get counsel in another way, the court may deem defn waives counsel. Defn states he has enough money to bail himself out tomorrow.  Ct happy to give defn time to retain counsel.  Yes, that is what he wants -- a few weeks.  ADA  requests court set case for STC so he does not have to bring witnesses and then we can schedule from there.  If defn does not have counsel at next hearing, the court will have a conversation with defn about the possibility of defn having waived counsel.  Ct advised defn of his bail conditions if released.
